author: Special Correspondent
text:
Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam affiliated to CPI and CPI (M) staged a demonstrated in front of the Head Post Office here on Tuesday to protest against laying gas pipeline for GAIL project through agricultural lands.

P. Shanmugam, State general secretary, Tamil Nadu Vivasayigal Sangam (CPI-M), led the agitation. District secretaries P.Thangavel (CPI-M), A. Mohan (CPI) and others spoke highlighting the demand.

They said that the execution of GAIL pipeline laying project will badly hit the farmers of Sankagiri, Morur, Kasthuripattu, Vettukadupatti, Vaikuntam, Ollakkasinnanur, Kannantheri, Puthur, Thoppur, Omalur, Muthunayakkanpatti in Salem district.

The farmers have raised mango, jackfruit trees in large numbers in these farm lands and the felling of the trees will cause heavy financial loss to them.

They demanded the government to lay the GAIL pipeline through the national highways. The government should do away with its move of acquiring farm lands for the execution of the GAIL project.

Erode Special Correspondent adds

In Erode, members of farmers’ organisations and political parties staged a demonstration on Tuesday assailing the move by Gas Authority of India Limited (GAIL) to lay natural gas pipelines across agricultural fields.
title: “Lay gas pipeline through NH”
